author: Staff Reporter
text:
With 39 flying squads formed to monitor the implementation of model code of conduct in Vellore district, their movement can now be tracked by the election officials. Global Positioning System (GPS) devices have been fitted in the vehicles allotted to the flying squads.

The squads, each consisting of one official, two police personnel and a videographer, are involved in monitoring the 13 Assembly constituencies in the district. Three teams have been allotted for each constituency.

“The GPS devices have been fitted in the 39 vehicles used by the flying squads to trace their movement. The District Election Officer will be able to keep track of the vehicle’s movement by logging into the system from anywhere,” an official said.

The squads patrol their respective areas round-the-clock on shift basis. They identify violations of the model code of conduct and work along with the officers of the Corporation, municipalities, town panchayats and village panchayats to remove unauthorised wall paintings, posters, banners and flags of political parties.

In Vellore district, wall paintings, banners, posters and flags of political parties have been removed from a total of 1,473 places till now. This work is going on in full swing across the district, a press release said.
title: Flying squad vehicles on election duty fitted with GPS devices
